title: Automation.com - All Industrial Automation News and Products

items.title: Siemens and Envalior Collaborate on More Sustainable Electrical Products
LKAB and ABB Partner to Electrify and Automate Mining
items.summary:
- ABB and LKAB signed an MoU to co-develop *automation*, *electrification* and *digitalization* technologies for next‑generation energy, production management and robotics in mining.
- The collaboration will explore *BEV charging*, battery management, smarter power distribution, production optimization (ventilation, milling, flotation) and robotization like automated blast charging to improve safety and sustainability.
- A joint steering group will fast-track pilots to large‑scale deployment to set an industry benchmark for *safer*, more *productive* and lower‑carbon mining.

items.title: Case Study: Balluff and Kardex Deliver AutoStore ASRS System Within Six Months
NEMA Adds Two New Manufacturing Companies to Membership, Strengthening the Electroindustry’s Impact
Offense Is the New Defense in National Cyber Strategies
items.summary:
- *NCC Group's* Global Cyber Policy Radar Edition 4 warns governments are shifting to **offensive cyber** postures and increasing investments, making cyber a strategic national-security tool.
- Rising focus on *supply chain* controls, reshoring and stricter procurement rules will expand private-sector obligations and regulatory complexity.
- Emphasis on **post-quantum cryptography** readiness and active defenses (e.g., honeypots) signals lasting changes in cyber governance and risk management.

items.title: The Power of AI and Human Collaboration in Supply Chain Decision Making
Flexxbotics’ FlexxCORE Named Finalist — Humanoid Robotics Awards 2025
items.summary:
- Flexxbotics’ *FlexxCORE* was named a finalist in the Groundbreaking Technology category of the Humanoid Robotics Industry Awards 2025.
- *FlexxCORE* securely connects and coordinates humanoid robots with factory equipment, IT systems, and people to enable robot-driven manufacturing.
- Public voting is open and winners will be announced Nov. 5, 2025, highlighting Flexxbotics’ role in advancing *humanoid-enabled smart factories*.

items.title: KUKA to Showcase Automation at Robonumérique Lévis 2025
items.author: KUKA Systems Corp. North America
items.summary:
- At Robonumérique Lévis (Nov 4–5) *KUKA* will demo advanced automation including the *KMP 600P* AMR, robotics education cells, and digital tools like *iiQKA.OS*.
- A plug-and-play *KR CYBERTECH nano* welding cell uses real-time vision and *AI* plus virtual scanning to auto-adjust welding paths with no coding or CAD required.
- KUKA emphasizes intralogistics, training solutions and responsive support (my.KUKA.com, spare parts, simulation) to simplify adoption across North America.

items.title: ABB Automation Technology to Modernize and Future-Proof ENGIE Power Plant
Rockwell Appoints Mark Bottomley VP, Market Access EMEA
items.summary:
- Rockwell Automation named **Mark Bottomley** regional vice president for *Market Access* in **EMEA**, tasking him with regional leadership, growth and channel development.
- He will *evolve the distributor strategy* and expand the company's **PartnerNetwork** to extend market reach and strengthen partner collaboration across the region.
- With Rockwell tenure since 2007 and EMEA leadership since 2019, Bottomley is expected to drive accelerated growth and partner-focused execution.

items.title: Mouser Spotlights Power Management Solutions in Ebook From Analog Devices
Hai Robotics Wins Technology Excellence Award at PACK EXPO Las Vegas 2025 for HaiPick Climb System
Topical Roundup: October 2025
Definitions of IT/OT Convergence Shape OT Cybersecurity Risks and Solutions
Qatar's NCSA Joins ISASecure
items.summary:
- Qatar's *National Cyber Security Agency (NCSA)* has joined **ISASecure**, adopting ISA/IEC 62443 standards to boost industrial automation and control systems security.
- The move aims to strengthen *OT security maturity*, align national policies with global best practices, and enhance international collaboration on protecting *critical infrastructure*.
- Membership connects Qatar to a global ecosystem of industry leaders and supports long-term resilience through standards-based certification.

items.title: Regulatory and Standards Developments Are Affecting OT Cybersecurity in Europe
October Is Cybersecurity Awareness Month
items.author: Renee Bassett
items.summary:
- October is Cybersecurity Awareness Month, themed *Building a Cyber Strong America*, urging stronger defenses for U.S. critical infrastructure—from utilities to small and medium businesses.
- Federal lead *CISA* provides no‑cost resources and best practices, framing cybersecurity as a public‑safety and economic priority for SLTT governments and organizations.
- *ISA* highlights OT cybersecurity training and standards (notably *ISA/IEC 62443*) and offers discounts through Oct 31 to help implement resilient controls.

items.title: SOMIC Packaging Hosts Minnesota Open House
items.summary:
- SOMIC Packaging welcomed more than 120 guests to an Open House at its new 48,000 sq ft North American HQ in Inver Grove Heights, MN, showcasing tours, speeches, and local leaders on Sept. 25, 2025.
- Attendees saw an early preview of the *434 SuperFlex*, SOMIC’s most revolutionary end‑of‑line packaging machine, ahead of its PACK Expo Las Vegas introduction.
- Company leaders highlighted *SOMIC DNA*, U.S. investment and that North American machines are now assembled in Minnesota—**made in the USA**.

items.title: Bosch Rexroth and SYNAOS Integrate K.Hartwall’s AMR A-MATE Lite Into the SYNAOS Intralogistics Platform
Wieland & Ross Offer TÜV-Certified CFSE Safety Courses
items.summary:
- Wieland Electric, partnering with Ross Controls, launched *TÜV-certified* **CFSE** five-day courses to train engineers, designers and safety officers in electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic functional safety within the CE process.  
- The modular curriculum covers risk assessment under *EN ISO 12100*, performance-level calculations, sensor application and V&V per *EN ISO 13849-2*, adaptable to participants' experience.  
- Courses run across the U.S. and Mexico in late 2025; certificates last *4 years* and are renewable via a one-day refresher for cross-industry recognition.

items.title: Powering Through Geopolitical Storms With Local Supply Chains That Have Safety Built In
3D Stereo Imaging Enables Precise Non-Contact Vibration Measurement of Hovering Multicopter
Dart Controls Inducted Into the Indiana Manufacturing Hall of Fame
Siemens & Ducati Renew MotoGP Tech Partnership
items.summary:
- Siemens and Ducati renewed a two‑year technical partnership using **Siemens Xcelerator** to accelerate development of more powerful, safe and sustainable motorcycles, including remote design and trackside 3D printing.
- Ducati uses *Teamcenter*, *Polarion*, *NX*, *Simcenter* and *Fibersim* to build a digital thread that integrates simulation, test data and ERP, eliminating silos between racing and street teams.
- The collaboration shortens development cycles and transfers race innovations to production — aiding Ducati Lenovo’s 2025 MotoGP wins and strengthening long‑term competitiveness.

items.title: International Robot Safety Conference to be Held in Houston Nov. 3-5
Allient Update on Global Capabilities to Advance Drone Market Solutions
Raymond Celebrates 11th Manufacturing Day
items.summary:
- The Raymond Corporation hosted its 11th annual *Manufacturing Day* in Greene, NY, welcoming high school juniors and seniors for presentations, interactive booths, and facility tours.  
- Leaders including VP Ryan DeLaney and associate presenters highlighted **career pathways**, *innovation*, *AI* advancements, and sustainability in manufacturing.  
- The in-person event aims to inspire *students* toward material-handling careers and build the industry's future talent pipeline.

items.title: Service Robots See Global Growth Boom
items.summary:
- Sales of professional *service robots* reached nearly **200,000** units in 2024 (+9%), driven by staff shortages and rising demand from an aging population while *RaaS* (robot-as-a-service) fleets expanded rapidly.
- Top applications were *transportation & logistics* (102,900 units, +14%), hospitality (~42,000, -11%), professional cleaning (+34%), and a strong surge in **medical robots** (+91% to ~16,700 units; diagnostics up ~610%).
- Consumer robots sold ~20 million units (+11%), led by domestic cleaning, and the market is shifting toward subscription/rental models and broader automation in healthcare and logistics.

items.title: HANNOVER MESSE Launches Call for Participation
items.summary:
- HANNOVER MESSE 2026 is inviting exhibitors to submit contributions by *Jan. 30, 2026*, featuring new participation formats such as *Solutions Labs* (Halls 11, 12, 26), masterclasses, speed‑dating and round tables.
- The *Solutions Labs* enable curated, practical dialogues between industry, research and startups, while the *Center Stage* (Hall 24) will host global keynotes, panels, live demos and startup pitches on *Industry 4.0*, *AI*, energy, sustainable production and mobility.
- The fair runs Apr 20–24, 2026 in Hanover, attracts about *4,000 exhibitors*, names Brazil as partner country, and aims to boost networking, innovation and visibility for participants.

items.title: What Are Polyglot Files, and What Is Their OT Security Risk?
The Quiet Revolution in Mobile Computing: Why Rugged Computing Is a Strategic Necessity
NORD Electric Motors Deliver Reliability, Versatility and Energy-Efficient Performance
Siemens Recognized as a Leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for Global Industrial IoT Platforms
Poultry Plants Cut Downtime With ABB’s Food Safe Feather Picker Motor
items.summary:
- ABB introduced a new *Food Safe Feather Picker* motor (3‑HP, NEMA 145) to help poultry plants cut downtime by enabling **direct replacements** and faster swaps across facilities.
- Built from 304 stainless steel with *IP69* protection, a 360° rotatable conduit box, dual‑voltage support and optional pre‑wired washdown versions for easier sanitation and maintenance.
- The expansion supports regulatory *food safety* compliance, motor standardization across applications, and includes a three‑year warranty to reduce long‑term operating costs.

items.title: How Failing Fast Can Improve Innovation, Agility and Reliability in Manufacturing
ESD Alliance Reports Electronic System Design Industry Posts $5.1 Billion in Revenue in Q2 2025
Zerova & WAGO Validate Modbus Integration for EV Charging
items.summary:
- Zerova and WAGO completed a joint validation proving full interoperability between *Zerova* EV chargers and *WAGO* Modbus controllers, enabling seamless on‑premise integration.
- The confirmed Modbus link delivers **resilience** via local control, *lower latency* for faster response, and a *hybrid architecture* that blends local and cloud intelligence.
- This enables scalable deployments for fleets and commercial sites, supporting *load balancing*, microgrid integration and long‑term sustainability for EV infrastructure.

items.title: Best Practices to Maximize Precision and Cost-Efficiency With Photo-Chemical Etching
ABB Leader in 2025 Verdantix Green Quadrant
items.summary:
- ABB was named a *Leader* in Verdantix's 2025 Green Quadrant for Industrial AI Analytics, with ABB Ability *Genix* highlighted for comprehensive data integration and advanced model development.
- Verdantix gave ABB top scores for *energy/resource management* (including a UK customer CO₂ reduction of 8–12%) and praised Genix's mix of AutoML, MLOps and low-code tools for scalable industrial AI.
- Genix's *agentic automation*, prebuilt industrial apps and multi-system contextualization position it for multi-site manufacturers and heavy process industries to scale predictive maintenance and sustainability.

items.title: HIMA Appoints CEO for Sella Controls
items.summary:
- *Carl Ramsden* was appointed CEO of *Sella Controls* (a HIMA company) effective Oct. 1, 2025, marking a milestone in deeper *integration* into the HIMA Group.
- He brings 20+ years of international leadership and financial experience across industrial and technology sectors and will lead the company alongside CTO *Chris Parr* and CSO *Eddy Turnock*.
- Acquired in Feb 2023, Sella Controls is now HIMA's UK & Ireland regional centre and global railway centre of excellence with ~130 employees, aiming to accelerate growth in *process* and *rail* industries.

items.title: Evolution, State of the Art and Standardization of Virtual PLCs
EZ Automation Demonstrates AI-Powered PIQuE Inspection System at ISA's Automation Summit & Expo
Festo Automation Streamlines Wafer Production
items.author: Festo Corporation
items.summary:
- Festo showcases an interconnected semiconductor workflow centered on a cost-effective inverted *gantry* with a combined *wafer* gripper and **integrated aligner** for sub‑micron positioning.
- Modules demonstrate *wet chemistry* coating with MFC‑controlled FOUP purges and a suction‑back nozzle for even application, plus *vacuum* processes with gentle valve control and pneumatic micro‑positioning.
- The suite aims to boost *throughput*, accuracy, and reliability while supporting digitalization, AI predictive maintenance, cleanroom compatibility, and workforce training.

items.title: Case Study: Heritage Petroleum Company Upgrades SCADA System With Skkynet Software
How Mini-Load and Pallet-Load ASRS Are Reshaping Warehouse Efficiency
PI opens US factory to boost support and cut tariff risk
items.summary:
- The new *140,000 sq ft* PI factory in Shrewsbury, MA, opening Nov 2025, **triples** U.S. capacity to manufacture advanced motion, *piezoelectric* and nanopositioning systems.
- Localizing production aims to *reduce import tariffs*, shorten lead times, stabilize supply chains and improve North American customer support.
- The site will create high‑quality engineering jobs and position PI as a hub for innovation in *semiconductor*, *photonics*, aerospace and life‑sciences technologies.

items.title: PI opens Shrewsbury U.S. factory to bolster support
items.summary:
- PI will open a 140,000‑sq‑ft Shrewsbury facility in November 2025, tripling its U.S. footprint to *localize production* and reduce exposure to import tariffs.
- Manufacturing will include **nanopositioning**, piezo transducers, air bearings and automation to shorten lead times and improve North American customer support.
- The plant will create high‑quality engineering jobs and act as a hub for innovation across *photonics*, semiconductors, aerospace and life sciences.

items.title: ANCA Names Christopher Weaver Group CFO
items.summary:
- ANCA appoints *Christopher Weaver* as **Group CFO**, signaling renewed focus on *strategic investment* and financial leadership.
- Weaver brings 25+ years across engineering, manufacturing and finance, with experience in *M&A*, ERP and global expansion to support ANCA's growth.
- His hire coincides with the retirement of long-serving CFO Gary Ward and underscores ANCA’s push into *AI integration* and next-generation *CNC manufacturing*.

items.title: E Tech Group Renames Recently Acquired JSat Automation
items.summary:
- E Tech Group *renamed* the recently acquired JSat Automation to operate under the **E Tech Group** brand after completing the acquisition on May 28, 2025.
- The move expands E Tech Group’s **global footprint** with 10 additional locations (US, Costa Rica, India, Netherlands, Romania, Singapore, Switzerland, UK) and adds capabilities like *LAIR*, *GMP* consulting and multisite MES.
- Leadership says the change ensures seamless continuity for clients, strengthens its role as **Main Automation Partner**, and creates new opportunities for employees.

items.title: EDM Association Acquires Assets of Object Management Group, Creating World’s Largest Data and Standards Community
